Authors: Saputra D., Adiputra I., Gharnaditya D., Budiman P.C., Diana V.
Title: Factors influencing behavioral intention in purchasing groceries through E-commerce XYZ's virtual store
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Saputra, D., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Adiputra, I., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Gharnaditya, D., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budiman, P.C., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Diana, V., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This research aims to find out the partial and simultaneous effect of Performance Expectancy, Effort Expectancy, Price Value, Facilitating Conditions, Habit, Personal Innovativeness in Information Technology, and Brand Image on Behavioral Intention in purchasing groceries through virtual store. The study was conducted using quantitative method, data collected through questioners distributed to 619 respondents, measured by 5 Point Likert scale and data analyze using multiple regression analysis on UTAUT 2 model. Result of this research showed that all independent variables have significant influence both partially and simultaneously on dependent variable, with Effort Expectancy has the most significant influence and Facilitating Conditions has the least significant influence on Behavioral Intention. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Behavioral intention; Multiple regression; Personal innovativeness; UTAUT2; Virtual store
Index Keywords: Behavioral intention; Dependent variables; Facilitating conditions; Independent variables; Multiple regression analysis; Personal innovativeness; Quantitative method; Simultaneous effects; Information management

Authors: Adiputra I., Saputra D., Sebayang T.E., Desvi P.S.
Title: Vendor efficiency evaluation regarding product delivery in Indonesian logistic service providers
Source title: International Journal of Innovation, Creativity and Change
Affiliations: Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adiputra, I., Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Saputra, D., Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Sebayang, T.E., Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Desvi, P.S., Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The use of vendors is one solution to expand the area of delivery of goods, which has been done by most Indonesian logistic service providers (LSP). Periodic evaluations need to be completed to ensure the efficiency of vendors who have collaborated. The research approach used in this study is quantitative-exploratory, data is collected through reports of one well-known LSPs in Indonesia for 5 vendors, the official BPS website and structured questionnaires. Data is processed using Data Envelopment Analysis (DEA) and Technique for Order of Preference by Similarity to Ideal Solution (TOPSIS) methods. The results show that there are 4 vendors are running efficiently and 2 vendors are running inefficiently with 1 of the vendors being recommended as best in delivering goods. © 2020, Primrose Hall Publishing Group.
Author Keywords: DEA; Efficiency; LSP; Topsis; Vendor evaluation
